intro: Coreopsis togensis, commonly known as the Tog River coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Tog River valley in Central Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces bright yellow to orange flowers with five petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open grasslands and along riverbanks. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
